page.title: 05Ecology - Footpaths etc.
page.content: Ecology - Footpaths & Rights of Way Within this block there are approximately 3 miles of definitive footpaths. Most of these extend futher but only for short distances. As in the rest of the country, these led to and from church, village or places of work and have largely disappeared. The remaining few are used by ramblers or local walkers and in this area are passable but often with seasonal difficulty as they are used insufficiently to justify their upkeep. The Rights of Way Committee of the Ross Civic Trust have enlisted the help of Parish Councils to try and establish a system of paths which provides less nuisance to farmers by reducing the number of unecessary ones crossing their land.
